abstract.p: Soil type played the most important role in the growth of A. adenophora, and the role of the foliar fungus Colletotrichum sp. varied according to different habitats but in general adversely affected the growth of A. adenophora. The Colletotrichum sp. might be a weak latent pathogen and enhanced the pathogenicity of Diaporthe helianthi on leaves of A. adenophora. Colletotrichum sp. marginally reduced the feeding frequency of seedlings by natural enemies in the wild.
